answerText: Arundhati Roy[10] Roy's only novel is this work partly set in her native Kerala, in which the mute Estha and his twin sister Rahel are molested in their youth by the Orangedrink Lemondrink Man and commit incest at the very end.
heading: ACF Regionals |2012 | Alabama + Yale C + Alberta | 9 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] Name this author whose most significant works of nonfiction include "The End of Imagination" and a 2001 essay which criticized the knee-jerk response of the Bush administration to 9/11.
